meanings.definition: The left side of a ship when facing forward.
meanings.sent1: The sailor stood on the larboard side of the ship, gazing out at the vast ocean.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered the crew to unload the cargo from the larboard side of the ship.
meanings.sent3: As the ship turned, the seagull on the larboard side squawked in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight cast a mysterious glow on the larboard side of the ship, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashed against the larboard side, spraying salty mist into the air.

meanings.definition: To turn or shift to the left.
meanings.sent1: The helmsman began to larboard the ship, following the captain's orders.
meanings.sent2: The car started to larboard as the driver made a sharp left turn.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to larboard its path, but ended up getting lost in the maze.
meanings.sent4: The dancer gracefully larboarded across the stage, captivating the audience with her movements.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to larboard, pushing the sailboat off course towards the rocky shore.
